resource.description: This dataset is an inventory of Pavement Messages on Hawaii Highways. resource.name: HDOT_PFES_2020_Final
resource.description:
Hawaii Department of Transportation (HDOT) has
implemented a pavement management program to preserve
Hawaii’s existing infrastructure. This program recommends
scheduling timely regular maintenance and performing
preservation treatments, in conjunction with rehabilitation and
reconstruction to extend the life of the pavement. Scheduling
regular upkeep will help prevent deterioration and provide the
best value to the agency at the lowest life cycle cost.

resource.name: Tsunami Safe Zones
resource.description:
Tsunami Safe Zones for the islands Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, Lanai and Maui.
Sources: Island of Oahu:  City and County of Honolulu, 2015; Islands of Maui, Molokai and Lanai:  County of Maui, 2016; Islands of Kauai and Niihau:  County of Kauai, 2016. Boundaries are based on peer review of the inundation models provided by UH Researchers and the operational needs of Hawaii's First Responders and the Emergency Management Community. For additional information, please refer to complete metadata at https://files.hawaii.gov/dbedt/op/gis/data/tsunevac.pdf or contact Hawaii Statewide GIS Program, Office of Planning and Sustainable Development, State of Hawaii; PO Box 2359, Honolulu, Hi. 96804; (808) 587-2846; email: gis@hawaii.gov; Website: https://planning.hawaii.gov/gis.

resource.name: 1% Coastal Flood Zone with 3.2 ft Sea Level Rise - Statewide
resource.description:
Tropical storms, hurricanes, and tsunamis create waves that flood low-lying coastal areas. The National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP) produces flood insurance rate maps (FIRMs) that depict flood risk zones referred to as Special Flood Hazard Areas (SFHA) based modeling 1%-annual-chance flood event also referred to as a 100-year flood. The purpose of the FIRM is twofold: (1) to provide the basis for application of regulatory standards and (2) to provide the basis for insurance rating.

SFHAs identify areas at risk from infrequent but severe storm-induced wave events and riverine flood events that are based upon historical record. By law (44 Code of Federal Regulations [CFR] 60.3), FEMA can only map flood risk that will be utilized for land use regulation or insurance rating based on historical data, therefore, future conditions with sea level rise and other impacts of climate change are not considered in FIRMs. It is important to note that FEMA can produce Flood Insurance Rate Maps that include future condition floodplains, but these would be considered “awareness” zones and not to be used for regulatory of insurance rating purposes.

The State of Hawai‘i 2018 Hazard Mitigation Plan incorporated the results of modeling and an assessment of vulnerability to coastal flooding from storm-induced wave events with sea level rise (Tetra Tech Inc., 2018). The 1% annual-chance-coastal flood zone with sea level rise (1%CFZ) was modeled to estimate coastal flood extents and wave heights for wave-generating events with sea level rise. Modeling was conducted by Sobis Inc. under State of Hawaiʻi Department of Land and Natural Resources Contract No: 64064. The 1%CFZ with 3.2 feet of sea level rise was utilized to assess vulnerability to coastal event-based flooding in mid to - late century.

The 1%CFZ with sea level rise would greatly expand the impacts from a 100-year flood event meaning that more coastal land area will be exposed to damaging waves. For example, over 120 critical infrastructure facilities in the City and County of Honolulu, including water, waste, and wastewater systems and communication and energy facilities would be impacted in the 1%CFZ with 3.2 feet of sea level rise (Tetra Tech Inc., 2018). This is double the number of facilities in the SFHA which includes the impacts of riverine flooding.


A simplified version of the Wave Height Analysis for Flood Insurance Studies (WHAFIS) extension (FEMA, 2019b) included in Hazus-MH, was used to create the 1% annual chance coastal floodplain. Hazus is a nationally applicable standardized methodology that contains models for estimating potential losses from earthquakes, floods, tsunamis, and hurricanes (FEMA, 2019a). 
The current 1%-annual-chance stillwater elevations were collected using the most current flood insurance studies (FIS) for each island conducted by FEMA (FEMA, 2004, 2010, 2014, 2015). The FIS calculates the 1%-annual-chance stillwater elevation, wave setup, and wave run-up (called maximum wave crest) at regularly-spaced transects around the islands based on historical data. Modeling for the 1%CFZ used the NOAA 3-meter digital elevation model (DEM) which incorporates LiDAR data sets collected between 2003 and 2007 from NOAA, FEMA, the State of Hawaiʻi Emergency Management Agency, and the USACE (NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information, 2017).
Before Hazus was run for future conditions, it was run for the current conditions and compared to the FEMA regulatory floodplain to determine model accuracy. This also helped determine the stillwater elevation for the large gaps between some transects in the FIS. Hazus was run at 0.5-foot stillwater level intervals and the results were compared to the existing Flood Insurance Rate Map (FIRM). The interval of 0.5-feet was chosen as a small enough step to result in a near approximation of the FIRM while not being too impractically narrow to require the testing of dozens of input elevations. The elevation which matched up

This is crashes data from FARS data and included additional fields that identified some crash factors that SHACA has to offer from Hawaii Police department reports. Its contains involved vehicle types, contributing factory to the crashes, and geolocation of the accidents.

Original period of performance end date for Construction.  If a renewal to the Construction end date is made, this field is filled in with the date that was originally granted for Construction.
Original period of performance end date for PE1.  If a renewal to the PE1 end date is made, this field is filled in with the date that was originally granted for PE1.
Construction period of performance end date. Date by which the project must be closed to continue to receive Federal participation.
Period of performance current variance date
Calculated title of project
Period of performance date (latest of all the period of performance dates set)
Material certification status. Words describing where the letter of material certs is in the closeout status. Based on information entered in the lab module of the database
Filled in by FHWA.  I supposed to reference STIP number, but not always clear which STIP the reference is to
The date Preliminary Engineering funds were first obligated.  This could refer to Planning, Design, or both.
Date the project was most recently reimbursed for
Original POP date for project in current phase
Unique ID assigned to each project. Assigned by HWY-SM based on JAs processed by HWY-SM. All projects beginning with charge codes 1, 2 or 6 are included.  Others are included by request.
The date SPR funds were first obligated.
Recipient project number.  This is the "Project Number" as recorded in FMIS.
Preliminary Engineering 2 (Design) period of performance end date. Date by which the design phase must be done (ROW or construction has been obligated) to continue to receive Federal participation.

Calculated Substantial completion date. If Substantial Completion date is entered in PSS, it uses that one.  Otherwise, it checks other fields to predict whether a project is complete even if a substantial completion date is not entered.
The date when the ineligible period (federal non-participating period) starts for the project
Branch that completed work

Project Status. For Construction: 1 is active, 2 is closeout, 3 is archived.  For Design, Planning, and ROW, 1 is programmed, 2 is active, 3 is archived, and 4 is cancelled.  For County projects, 1 is programmed, 2 is design, 3 is active construction, 4 is construction closeout, 5 is archived, and 6 is cancelled
FHWA remarks in FMIS
Date final voucher was granted for the project by FHWA
Name of contact person.  This field is only filled in if there is not a corresponding record in PSS
The date the state requested that the Federal division office grant final voucher
The date when the ineligible period (federal non-participating period) starts for the project
Period of performance status: Needs attention, Critical, Good
Percentage of work complete
Name of contact office.  This field is only filled in if there is not a corresponding record in PSS

Notice to proceed date for both State and County Projects. For contracts bid on prior to October 1, 2018 the NTP date and Start Date were synonomous and indicate the start of the contract time.  After October 1, 2018 the NTP date does not indicate
Date final construction acceptance was issued for state and county projects
Responsible person associated with project
State remarks in FMIS
Preliminary Engineering 1 (Planning) period of performance end date. Date by which the planning phase must be done to continue to receive Federal participation.
Sum of federal money remaining
Current Phase of Project (Planning, Design, Construction, ROW or County)
A number corresponding to the status of the project: 10=active, 11=closed, 13=withdrawn
Person in HWY-SM responsible for project (obligations, final closeout, etc)
Federal ID assigned to each project
Calculated project number
The Island the project is on.  This field is ONLY filled in if there is not a corresponding project in PSS
Period of performance variance. The difference (in days) between the POPEstimatedCompletionDate and the POPDate.
Current project status
Financial Ineligibility Number.  These are numbers assigned to projects that are non-participating due to Period of Peformance end dates expiring
If this is true, the project is still in fiscal closeout.  If this is false and the project is archived, this project is completely closed out.
1 = Programmed, 2 = Active, 3 = Archived (went to construction) , 4 = Cancelled or indefinately deferred
Project has been chosen by FHWA Division office as a PODI (project of division initerest) project
Period of performance variance rank
Priority date for SHPD list.  This date order is used for ordering shpd projects and is based on they type of projects and dates entered into the anticipated NEPA and the anticipated RTA in PSS.

This field is used for determining which PSS project is used for Federal listings if there is more than 1 PSS project with the same Federal ID.  If it is true, this PSS project will be used for the Federal Listing.  If it is false, it will not.
Amount of money set aside for advance construction
The amount of money obligated for this Federal ID
The first date any funds were obligated for this Federal ID
Federal project title. This is the project Title as recorded in FMIS
Original period of performance end date for ROW.  If a renewal to the ROW end date is made, this field is filled in with the date that was originally granted for ROW.
Original period of performance end date for PE2.  If a renewal to the PE2 end date is made, this field is filled in with the date that was originally granted for PE2.
Right of Way period of performance end date. Date by which the ROW phase must be done to continue to receive Federal participation.
Project status for Right of Way project. 1 is programmed, 2 is active, 3 is archived (ROW complete), and 4 is cancelled or indefinitely deferred
Email for users within Highways
The Federal Demonstration project ID.
Extended Phase
Period of performance phase.
Construction project status: 1: Active, 2: Closeout, 3: Archived (Done at district, fiscal closeout may still be pending)
Office associated with project
Is this a PE10 project? True or False
The date the PE10 requirement set by FHWA division office was met.  The date the project was removed from the PE10 list.
County project? True or False.  This field is only filled in if there is not a corresponding project in PSS
Is the project a county project? True or False
Utility agreement status. Words describing where the utility agreement is in the closeout process.  Based on dates entered in the disposition log by construction
Deadline to repay funds
True or False field for whether we are pursuing a period of performance extension for a project
The state has requested that the Federal division office grant final voucher
A field created to sort projects for particular reports (inactive, closeout, billing, etc).  Currently not being utilized.
Date that funds were repaid
Federal project status description. Active, Closed, or Withdrawn'

resource.name: BIKE-PM-CRASH_REVISED
resource.description: This dataset contains bicycle crash data for all roadways (county, state, federal) statewide. This dataset is updated annually. For questions, please contact: DOT.BikePedProgram@Hawaii.gov

resource.name: Final Bridge Condition 2020
resource.description: This dataset provides a condition ranking for all bridges in the Hawaii State Highway System as of 2020. The dataset is not set to update on a regular basis. Some information provided in this dataset includes: Island where the bridge resides, X/Y coordinates, Bridge GD and the condition of the bridge.

resource.name: HPMS Reliability Metric | Multi Year | Interstate and Non Interstate NHS
resource.description: This dataset provides interstate and non-interstate NHS travel reliability metrics from HPMS for 2018 and 2019. This dataset is used for measures associated with the Act 100 report, more specifically the system efficiency section. The measures consist of "Percent of the Person-Miles Traveled on the Interstate That Are Reliable" and "Percent of the Person-Miles Traveled on the Non-Interstate NHS That Are Reliable".

resource.name: HawaiiTT202004
resource.description:
Hawaii Truck Traffic April 2020 (04/2020).

This dataset displays truck traffic for April 2020 on all roads on the Hawaii State Highway System. This data is refreshed on a yearly basis.

Some data provided in this dataset includes: VMT, Route number, Name of road, etc.

resource.name: Project List | Active Modal Integration Projects FY2020 | STATIC
resource.description: This dataset is static and provides a list of active modal integration projects for the 2020 Act100 report. As mentioned, the dataset is static and the data will not change because the fiscal year has come to a close.
